themes: equitable funding for legacy and new organizations
support for individual artists (experienced and emerging)
funding based on arts excellence and accountability
restriction of HOT funds from profit businesses and startups
requirement for fiscal responsibility and matching funds
distribution based on standard arts practices
key_phrases: Fund legacy and newer arts organizations
including theaters, theater companies, organizations that support artists, especially individual artists, those experienced and emerging
Funding to based on arts excellence and accountability
HOT funds are not to be used as an economic engine for profit businesses or for business startups
Recipients must demonstrate fiscal responsibility, which occurs by requiring matches (in-kind and cash) for each contract/grant
Funding amounts to be distributed based on standard practices in the arts
barriers_identified: HOT funds used for profit businesses or startups
solutions_proposed: Fund both legacy and newer arts organizations, including those supporting individual artists
Base funding on arts excellence and accountability
Restrict HOT funds from being used for profit businesses or business startups
Require recipients to demonstrate fiscal responsibility through matching funds (in-kind and cash)
Distribute funding amounts based on standard practices in the arts
